solution_line_template: The average test score was {average_score} and Marco scored 10% less so {average_score}*{marco_discount_percent_decimal} = <<{average_score}*{marco_discount_percent_decimal}={marco_points_lower}>>{marco_points_lower} points lower

The average test score was {average_score} and Marco scored {marco_points_lower} points less so his test score was {average_score}-{marco_points_lower} = <<{average_score}-{marco_points_lower}={marco_score}>>{marco_score}

Margret received {margaret_extra_points} more points than Marco whose test score was {marco_score} so she made {margaret_extra_points}+{marco_score} = <<{margaret_extra_points}+{marco_score}={margaret_score}>>{margaret_score} on her test
